title: Atlantic, Trajan, 2Tone - Classic record label typefaces
content:
There are three typefaces from 3 classic record labels that I'd like to ID, so any help would be greatly appreciated!

They are:

ATLANTIC  
 [http://templatezone.com/rs/users/johnnie\_walker1@msn-com/Atlantic%20Reco...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150410014622/http:/templatezone.com/rs/users/johnnie_walker1@msn-com/Atlantic%20Records.jpg "http://templatezone.com/rs/users/johnnie\_walker1@msn-com/Atlantic%20Records.jpg")

TROJAN  
 [http://www.dancecrasher.co.uk/sweetsensation.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150410014622/http:/www.dancecrasher.co.uk/sweetsensation.jpg "http://www.dancecrasher.co.uk/sweetsensation.jpg")

2 TONE  
 [http://2-tone.info/lga/specials\_uk\_front.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150410014622/http:/2-tone.info/lga/specials_uk_front.jpg "http://2-tone.info/lga/specials\_uk\_front.jpg")
author: Marstrois

comments.content:
Atlantic: looks hand drawn for sure

2 Tone could be Helvetica Inserrat or another Helvetica (the Specials part, but not the 2 Tone part - that is not a Helvetica 2)

Trojan - I think also hand drawn - RECORDS is more condensed than TROJAN and that R has been customized for sure.

There seems to be more than 4 or 5 fonts on the 2 TONE cd. The track information is in Univers I think, the **2** feels like Avant Garde. The **SPECIALS** could be Helvetica Inserat but not quite? **RECORD** is something else completely, I think this is too much for me, Sorry! :^x
Patricia, I take forever to type so please excuse the overlap!
Thanks Geoff but Im only looking for SPECIALS and TROJAN if that makes it any easier!

SPECIALS does look a lot like Helvetica Inserrat. Bear in mind this is pre-digital (I have that album on vinyl!)

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/helvetica-inserat/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150410014622/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/helvetica-inserat/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/helvetica-inserat/")

TROJAN reminds me of Fashion Didot but it's not an exact match. There are a lot of fonts like that in the original Solotype and Photolettering catalogs - but many not digitized.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bagraphics/fashion-didot/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150410014622/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bagraphics/fashion-didot/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bagraphics/fashion-didot/")

Actually, the "TLANTIC" part of Atlantic in the sample you posted looks like a [squooshed](http://web.archive.org/web/20150410014622/http:/typophile.com/wiki/squooshed) version of [Helvetica Rounded Black Oblique](http://web.archive.org/web/20150410014622/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=LH.120906.0.28&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=TLANTIC&sampleSize=48) but the original Atlantic logo may have been hand-drawn.

- Lex
